practice.name: Review Task Order for Efficiency
practice.description: Regularly re-evaluate the sequence of tasks. Look for opportunities to group related changes or solve dependencies earlier to avoid rework.

practice.name: Context Discovery
practice.description: Before starting any task, perform a thorough search of the codebase to identify all affected files, existing patterns, and potential conflicts.

practice.name: Living Documentation
practice.description: Treat the task list as a dynamic document. If a task is found to be more complex than anticipated, break it down further into sub-tasks immediately.

practice.name: Mandatory Checkbox System
practice.description: Every task must lead with a checkbox. Use [ ] for pending tasks and [x] for completed tasks. If a task list is encountered that doesn't follow this, the very first action must be to add them.

practice.name: Pause for Ambiguity
practice.description: If a task requirement is unclear or multiple implementation paths exist with different tradeoffs, pause and ask the user for direction.

practice.name: Ask for Help Early
practice.description: If you encounter a technical blocker or a domain you are unfamiliar with, inform the user and ask for guidance or specific resources.

practice.name: Append Development Notes
practice.description: Always maintain a "Development Notes" section at the end of the main task document. Include: - Major decisions made and why. - Important implementation details. - Unresolved questions or "debt" introduced. - Suggestions for future development.

practice.name: Context-Rich Commit Messages
practice.description: When recording changes, ensure messages reference the specific task being addressed to maintain a clear audit trail.
